Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2023e3.utils

Class TimedEntity

java.lang.Object
fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2023e3.utils.TimedEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimingI, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompoundMeasure, Measure, SensorData
public abstract class TimedEntity extends Object implements TimingI
The class TimedEntity defines the common fields and methods managing the timing information of timed entities.

Description

The major implementation decision for this functionality is to use the class java.time.Instant to represent punctual times, as well as the class java.time.Duration to represent elapsed times.

Another important decision is to use IP addresses to identify hosts, which is indeed fragile as IP addresses can be local and also dynamically attributed to hosts.

White-box Invariant

 invariant      timestamp != null
 invariant      timestamper != null
 invariant      ac == null && getTimeReference().equals(getTimestamper()) || ac != null && getTimeReference().equals(ac.getClockURI())

Black-box Invariant

 invariant      true        // no more invariant

Created on : 2023-11-28

Author:
Jacques Malenfant

    UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TimedEntity()
    create a timed entity with the current time as time stamp, the current host as time stamper and its hardware clock giving the time reference.
    TimedEntity(fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks.AcceleratedClock ac)
    create a timed entity with the current time as time stamp, the current host as time stamper and the given accelerated clock giving the time reference.
    TimedEntity(fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks.AcceleratedClock ac, Instant timestamp)
    create a timed entity with the given time stamp and the current host as time stamper.
    TimedEntity(Instant timestamp)
    create a timed entity with the given time stamp and the current host as time stamper and its hardware clock giving the time reference.
    TimedEntity(Instant timestamp, String timestamper)
    create a timed entity with the given time stamp, time stamper identity and the current host hardware clock giving the time reference.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Duration
    freshness()
    return the freshness of the timed entity; if only one timing exists, the freshness is the duration between its time stamp and the current instant but when there are many timings, the freshness is the largest between the time stamps and the current time, both to be interpreted under the time reference.
    String
    getTimeReference()
    the time reference to be used to interpret the timing data; two time references are currently defined: if the host hardware clock is directly used, this method returns the same value as getTimestamper() but if an AcceleratedClock is used, the URI of this clock is returned and getTimestamper() returns the identity of the host which hardware clock that supports the AcceleratedClock.
    Instant
    getTimestamp()
    return the Instant at which a timed action has been taken that is interpretable by the context.
    String
    getTimestamper()
    return the identity of the time stamper that can be interpreted in the context; an empty string represents an unknown timing entity.
    Duration
    timeCoherence()
    compute the time coherence among the timings; if only one timing exists, as in scalar measures, the coherence is Duration.ZERO, otherwise it is the largest duration between distinct timings (e.g., for compound measures).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • getTimeReference

      public String getTimeReference()
      Description copied from interface: TimingI
      the time reference to be used to interpret the timing data; two time references are currently defined: if the host hardware clock is directly used, this method returns the same value as getTimestamper() but if an AcceleratedClock is used, the URI of this clock is returned and getTimestamper() returns the identity of the host which hardware clock that supports the AcceleratedClock.

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null && !return.isEmpty()
      Specified by:
      getTimeReference in interface TimingI
      Returns:
      the time reference of this timed entity.
      See Also:
      • TimingI.getTimeReference()
